alert.note: Alert for Butler; Ripley (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:38PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ripley and southwestern Butler Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 538 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Naylor, or 9 miles north of Corning, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Neelyville around 550 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Harviell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
